Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Well time is getting closer for my surgery, Its January 27, AT 12:30 pm I'M just about over this cold i picked up, did the paper work, trying to get in touch with TDI, my uro said I should be out 6 weeks, been buying depends, not sure how many to get, got a meeting on the 16 Jan for prep work, If anyone has any last suggestions for me please feel free to let me know, I'm OK with it but still a little nervous, Was anyone else nervous, Thank You all for your support,
Posts.Title: Time set for my Robotic Prostatectomy

Posts.Content: Hi all Just wounder if anyone is going thru ED depression, i'm about 11/2 year post op, With still no erection, they did remove one vein, Viagra, & Cialis did not work. the only thing that worked was that Penile Injection gel, I've been using the penis pump, Have not done the side injection yet, I real do no want the Penile Implant, I was thinking if i should of had radiation, But then again My Dr. never would of found the 2 hernia's that i had, so after my prostate removal, I had to have another surgery for my 2 hernia's, And that was very painful after the hernia surgery, at home it was very painful just to get out of bed, my PSA before the surgery was 4.9 now it's 0.1, I had a lot more energy before my prostate surgery, Just wondering, has anyone felt this way long after the surgery, Thanks,
Posts.Title: ED depression,

Posts.Content: Hi All Had my 2nd opinion, And the options for me were, Radiation or removal, I'm 57 and my Gleason scores are 3-6's and 2-7's , I was thinking of having removed By Robotic Surgery, But after a lot of research I came across this Proton beam Therapy, My cancer they say is contained to the prostate they say, My question is do you think that I'm a candidate for this type of procedure, or do you think I'm passed that point, I'm setting up another meeting with my Uro in a week to discuss this further, I want to go over all my options, Thank you all for your help.
Posts.Title: Proton beam radiation therapy

Posts.Content: Hi All. My Catheter was removed on Friday the 13, so far so good, Been urinating on my own, seems like quit a lot, was drinking 2 liters of water a day, But i'm going to cut back to 1/12 liters, Because that Friday night went to bed OK, until i had to get up to urinate, then it felt like I was getting up every 1 HR to urinate, Been also working on my bowel movements, there still hard, still taking the stool softeners, Been drinking warm prune juice helps some, eating fruits and some veggies, yogurt, So far I'm feeling pretty good visiting nurse stops by all my vital signs are good, one more time for that, Thank You All, you all Been so helpful
Posts.Title: Catheter Is out

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, I was supposed to have my prostate removed tomorrow, But due to this Blizzard were having on the east they canceled it, no use in risking anyone else's life, Now I have to wait 2 more weeks, February 10th at 10 am, I Decided to have the Robotic Prostatectomy, But I'm not complaining, As long as you have your faith and family and friends everything will work out, TY All,
Posts.Title: Canceled Due to Blizzard

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by shu246 Ummmmmm. How far did you get into the pre-op bowel purge routine? Never stated I waited until i heard from the coordinator I kept calling her, TY,
Posts.Title: Canceled Due to Blizzard

Posts.Content: Hi All, This is my 4 day out of Robotic Prostatectomy, ever thing went well, about a 31/2 hr procedure, Only when my URO was in there he saw 2 hernia's on each side my liver, he couldn't repair them then he didn't want the risk of infection, Another URO will repair them after i'm healed from my surgery, Been recovering at my mothers house, I've had a lot of abdominal pain pain level over 5, the last couple of days, just wondering if anyone went through this, the pain seems to be subsiding, Been taking the pills, I also have these dry coughing spells I use a pillow on my stomach to put a little pressure there, just wondering if anyone has had this dry coughing, Getting use to the catheter bags aren't they so much fun, should be getting it out this Friday the 13, cant wait, Thanks Again everyone,
Posts.Title: Made it to the other side

Posts.Content: Hi all just wounduring if any one had changed there diet once you found out that you have prostate cancer, And what types of food did you eat,
Posts.Title: Food and Prostate

Posts.Content: Hi all just wounduring if any one had changed there diet once you found out that you have prostate cancer, And what types of food did you eat,
Posts.Title: Food and Prostate

Posts.Content: Hi, New member here, I had my 2nd opinion at a Comprehensive cancer center in RI with 3 Dr's, and I was given couple of options, one was Radiation Therapy, and the other was Robotic Prostatectomy, my Gleason score from my biopsy came back as -- 3-6 & 2 - 7, mostly on the left side of the prostate, the Dr's agreed that the cancer is contained to the prostate, I'm in good health and 57 years old, I'm thinking of having it removed, I've been doing a lot of research on this whole matter, If I have it removed it will probably be done in the beginning of next year 2015, I was wounder what should I do to prepare myself for this, I read about start doing some pelvic exercises, and kegel exercises, my only symptom so far is frequent urination, and would like to know if anyone had changed there diet, before they had surgery, because of some foods affect the prostate, my farther had prostate cancer so mine is all hereditary, Thank You,
Posts.Title: Do Kegel Exercises Before Surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Thank you all for your help, Had my 3 hr Preadmission class today for my robotic surgery, it was very informative, Due date is Jan 27 they switched the time on me to 8:15 am kind of early, I'm trying to stay positive, picked up plenty of depends found the ones I like at Walgreen's, I just got over a cold I picked up, I took next week off to prepare myself stock up supply's, and relax, the hole experience seems so unreal, trying to input all this overwhelming information, My sister has been with me from the beginning thank god for her, and family, So I'm trying to stay positive and healthy, Thank You all,
Posts.Title: Thank you all for your help
